verses.roman:
prabhu yāṅra nitya laya thoḍa-mocā-phala
yāṅra phuṭā-lauhapātre prabhu pilā jala

synonyms: prabhu—the Lord; yāṅra—whose; nitya—daily; laya—takes; thoḍa—the pulp of the banana tree; mocā—the flowers of the banana tree; phala—the fruits of the banana tree; yāṅra—whose; phuṭā—broken; lauha-pātre—in the iron pot; prabhu—the Lord; pilā—drank; jala—water.
translation: Every day Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu jokingly snatched fruits, flowers and pulp from Śrīdhara and drank from his broken iron pot.
